div.p: To the Public Works Committee, Melbourne City Council
No. 2874, unit 905, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.
To the Chairman & the Members of the public works Committee of the City Council.

Allow me to ask, whether you would raise any objections tomy proposal, to close the fenceline of the city bridge opposite the Sandridge road Entrance (on the eastern side) and to allow a few rails to be put up from the boat houses to the Arch. By this arrangement & the closing in of the fence below the Immigrants Home it would be possible for me to remove the unsightly three rails fence out of the swamp. As now Yan-Yean-water is available everywhere, there will be no necessity to have a watering place at the City bridge. I would plant Willows & teatree & other suitable plantsthen nearthe Bridge, at an early date.
MS file annotation: 'Fence ordered to be done'. The council did not agree to all of M's proposals;seeE. FitzGibbon to M, 24 July 1867.
